items.name: Intro
items.label:
Welcome,
 
Thank you for taking the time to participate in the briefing session and for agreeing to participate in this research. 
Your involvment makes this study possible and it is thanks to you and the other participants that we will be able to contribute to psychological science.

#### Basic information
First, please enter your phone number and email address.
This information is necessary to automatically send you the questionnaires and any reminders.
items.label_parsed:
Welcome,

Thank you for taking the time to participate in the briefing session and for agreeing to participate in this research.
Your involvment makes this study possible and it is thanks to you and the other participants that we will be able to contribute to psychological science.

Basic information

First, please enter your phone number and email address.
This information is necessary to automatically send you the questionnaires and any reminders.

units.description: send out text-message to verify phone number
units.external_link:
library(httr)
#------- study checklist
# - check duration of days
# - check number of studies
# - check expiring time of the main survey

# ===================================
# ========== text-message SETTINGS ===========
# ===================================

nameRunProject = "ESM-Rum-EN"

# parameters of text-message gateway
base        = "https://WEBSITE ADRESS HERE"
requestUri  = "REQUEsT URI HERE"
apiKey      = "API KEY HERE"
device_number = 3

# ===================================
# ===================================

telephone = enrolling_surveyEN$gsm_verif # retrieve the stored phone number, you would use something like survey$mobile_number
session = survey_run_sessions$session
verif_code = enrolling_surveyEN$verification_code_sms

body_message = paste0("Here is your verification code for the study\n\n", verif_code,"\n\nHere is a link to return to the questionnaire if necessary : https://", nameRunProject,".formr.org/?code=", session, "\n")


result <- POST(
  url = base,
  path = requestUri,
  body = list(
    key = apiKey,
    number = telephone,
    message = body_message,
    devices = device_number
  ),
  encode = "form",
  verbose(),
  config = httr::config(connecttimeout = 120)
)
(result2 = content(result))

if(is.null(result2$error_code)) { FALSE } else { TRUE }

items.name: birthyear
items.label: Birth year
items.label_parsed: Birth year

items.name: code_anonyme
items.label:
In order to guarantee your anonymity, your answers will be associated with a code corresponding to the initials of your mother's first name and your father's first name followed by your date of birth in 6 numbers.    

E.g.: Marie's mother is called Nathalie, her father is called Thibault. Marie was born on June 16, 1986, the code will be NT160686 .    

Enter the initials of your mother's first name and your father's first name followed by your date of birth in 6 digits (jour/mois/annee), all attached and without spaces as in the example.
items.label_parsed:
In order to guarantee your anonymity, your answers will be associated with a code corresponding to the initials of your mother's first name and your father's first name followed by your date of birth in 6 numbers.

E.g.: Marie's mother is called Nathalie, her father is called Thibault. Marie was born on June 16, 1986, the code will be NT160686 .

Enter the initials of your mother's first name and your father's first name followed by your date of birth in 6 digits (day/month/year), all attached and without spaces as in the example.

units.description: If enough rows have passed, then skip to end
units.condition:
# repeat till the maximum number of surveys has been achieved
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)

# ===================================
# ====== define all variables =======
# ===================================

days_duration_study = 14
surveys_by_day      = 4
timezone            = "CET"
to_day              = today(timezone)
now_date            = now(timezone)
t_zero              = "00:05"
last_timepoint      = "23:30"
timepoints          = c("09:00", "13:00","17:00","21:00")  # write just the hours
ESM_questionnaire   = EF_RUM_ESM_v2_EN

# ===================================
# ===================================


max_surveys = surveys_by_day * days_duration_study

if(!exists("ESM_questionnaire")){
days = ESM_questionnaire %>% mutate(day = as.Date(created)) %>% summarize(n_days = n_distinct(day))

days$n_days >= days_duration_study } else { FALSE }

units.description: Pause till start of the study the next day
units.body:
```{r, include=FALSE, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE} library(dplyr) library(lubridate) # =================================== # ====== define all variables ======= # =================================== days_duration_study = 14 surveys_by_day = 4 timezone = "CET" to_day = today(timezone) now_date = now(timezone) t_zero = "00:05" last_timepoint = "23:30" timepoints = c("09:00", "13:00","17:00","21:00") # write just the hours ESM_questionnaire = EF_RUM_ESM_v2_EN # =================================== # =================================== # =================================== # =================================== max_surveys = surveys_by_day * days_duration_study days_done = 0 text = "" # ==================================== # == first check whether they enrolled into the study # ==================================== if(!exists("ESM_questionnaire") || nrow(ESM_questionnaire) == 0){ text = paste0("Your email address and mobile phone number have been confirmed. This allows us to be sure that you will receive reminders by text-message and email to complete the questionnaires. ") } else { # ==================================== # == option 2 : they already started the esm period # ==================================== # lets check how many questionnaires they filled Nsurv_filled_today = ESM_questionnaire %>% select(ended) %>% filter(!is.na(ended)) %>% mutate(ended = as.Date(ended)) %>% filter(ended == to_day) %>% nrow() print(Nsurv_filled_today) date_start = as.Date(enrolling_surveyEN$created) last_day_study = as.Date(enrolling_surveyEN$created)+ days(days_duration_study) # get the numbers of day left days_left = last_day_study - today() # difftime(df$datevar1 ,df$datevar2 , units = c("days")) days_done = days_duration_study - days_left if(!is.na(Nsurv_filled_today)){ completion_rate = Nsurv_filled_today/surveys_by_day * 100 } else { completion_rate = 0 } if(completion_rate >= 70) { text = paste0("Today, you had a response rate of ", completion_rate,"% ! This is really great, thanks for taking this research seriously.") } else if(completion_rate <= 30){ text = paste0(text, "We can see that you only answered one questionnaire today. Do not hesitate to contact me () if you have any problems or difficulties with the study") } else { text = "" } # } # create intermittent reinforcement messages reinforcement = "" d = days_done + 1 reinforcement <- switch(d, "0" = "### Thank you for your participation!", "1" = "Thank you for your participation ! Please let us know if you encounter any difficulties in completing the questionnaires or participating in this study: ", "2" = "### Thank you for your participation!", "3" = "### Thank you for your participation!", "4" = "Already 4 days! \n\n We want to thank you and encourage you to continue. As simple as it may seem, each answer you provide improves the quality of this study, helps us to better understand our thoughts in our daily lives and, above all, contributes to the advancement of psychological research. Thank you for your involvement throughout these four days. \n\n Please do not hesitate to send us your questions or concerns about the questionnaires ( ). This study is unique; so is your participation.", "5" = "### Thank you for your participation!", "6" = "### Thank you for your participation!", "7" = "### Thank you for your participation!", "8" = "This is remarkable. You have completed more than half of the study! Your experience and involvement in this research directly enhances the quality of this research. Thank you for your commitment !", "9" = "### Thank you for your participation!", "10" = "### Thank you for your participation!", "11" = "Only 3 days left, it's the final stretch! Every answer matters and allows us to make our statistical analysis more reliable.", "12" = "### Thank you for your participation!", "13" = "The end of the study is near, only one day left!", "14" = "### Thank you for your participation!",) # let's create a progress visual progress = "" for(i in 1:days_duration_study) { if(i <= days_done) { progress = paste0(progress, "\n### **Day** **",i,"** ![](https://i.imgur.com/nUY7Ifu.png){width=50px}\n") } else if (i > days_done) { progress = paste0(progress, "\n### **Day** **",i,"** ![](https://i.imgur.com/5OY8PC6.png){width=50px}\n") } } ``` *** `r reinforcement`
`r text` *** Tomorrow, you will receive an invitation by text-message to complete the questionnaire at `r paste(timepoints, sep=", ")`. You will have **2 hours maximum** to answer each time. However, try to respond as soon as possible. You will receive 1 reminder by *text-message* one hour after the first notification. See you tomorrow! *** ### Your progress : `r progress` *** You can close this page now.

units.description: Check if it's later than 23:00 or if it's already the last day (just in case)
units.condition:
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)

# ===================================
# ====== define all variables =======
# ===================================

days_duration_study = 14
surveys_by_day      = 4
timezone            = "CET"
to_day              = today(timezone)
now_date            = now(timezone)
t_zero              = "00:05"
last_timepoint      = "23:30"
timepoints          = c("09:00", "13:00","17:00","21:00")  # write just the hours

# ===================================
# ===================================


max_surveys = surveys_by_day * days_duration_study


date_start = as.Date(enrolling_surveyEN$created)
last_day_study = as.Date(enrolling_surveyEN$created)+ days(days_duration_study)

today() > last_day_study || now_date > force_tz(today(tz = timezone) + hm(last(timepoints)), tzone = timezone)

units.relative_to:
library(lubridate)
library(hms)
# ===================================
# ====== define all variables =======
# ===================================

days_duration_study = 14
surveys_by_day      = 4
timezone            = "CET"
to_day              = today(timezone)
now_date            = now(timezone)
t_zero              = "00:05"
last_timepoint      = "23:30"
timepoints          = c("09:00", "13:00","17:00","21:00")  # write just the hours

# ===================================
# ===================================


t1 = force_tz(today("CET") + hm(timepoints[1]), tzone = timezone)
t2 = force_tz(to_day + hm(timepoints[2]), tzone = timezone)
t3 = force_tz(to_day + hm(timepoints[3]), tzone = timezone)
t4 = force_tz(to_day + hm(timepoints[4]), tzone = timezone)

# calculer quand le questionnaire sera envoy√© ensuite
time = ""

if(now_date < t1) { 
time = t1
} else if(now_date < t2) { 
time = t2
} else if(now_date < t3) { 
time = t3
} else if(now_date < t4) { 
time = t4
}

as_hms(time)

units.external_link:
library(httr)

# ===================================
# ========== text-message SETTINGS ===========
# ===================================

nameRunProject = "ESM-Rum-EN"

# parameters of SMS gateway
base        = "https://WEBSITE URL"
requestUri  = "REQUEST URI"
apiKey      = "API KEY"
device_number = 3

# ===================================
# ===================================

telephone = enrolling_surveyEN$telephone # retrieve the stored phone number, you would use something like survey$mobile_number
session = survey_run_sessions$session

body_message = paste0("Hello,\nHere is the link to answer the questionnaire: https://", nameRunProject,".formr.org/?code=", session, "\nAnswer it as soon as possible.\nThank you very much in advance.\nYorgo H.")


result <- POST(
  url = base,
  path = requestUri,
  body = list(
    key = apiKey,
    number = telephone,
    message = body_message,
    devices = device_number
  ),
  encode = "form",
  verbose(),
  config = httr::config(connecttimeout = 120)
)
(result2 = content(result))

if(is.null(result2$error_code)) { FALSE } else { TRUE }

units.description: First reminder after 60 minutes if the person has not yet responded

units.external_link:
library(httr)

# ===================================
# ========== text-message SETTINGS ===========
# ===================================

nameRunProject = "ESM-Rum-EN"

# parameters of SMS gateway
base        = "https://WEBSITE URL"
requestUri  = "REQUEST URI"
apiKey      = "PUT YOUR API KEY HERE"
device_number = 3

# ===================================
# ===================================

telephone = enrolling_surveyEN$telephone # retrieve the stored phone number, you would use something like survey$mobile_number
session = survey_run_sessions$session


body_message = paste0("REMINDER: please do not forget to answer the questionnaire.\n\nHere is the link to answer the questionnaire : https://", nameRunProject,".formr.org/?code=", session, "\nYou have 60 minutes to answer.\nThank you very much in advance.\nYorgo H.")

result <- POST(
  url = base,
  path = requestUri,
  body = list(
    key = apiKey,
    number = telephone,
    message = body_message,
    devices = device_number
  ),
  encode = "form",
  verbose(),
  config = httr::config(connecttimeout = 120)
)
(result2 = content(result))

if(is.null(result2$error_code)) { FALSE } else { TRUE }

items.name: introduction
perseverance
items.label: How much time did you spend thinking of one or more emotional experiences? This question refers to how much time you spent lost in your thoughts, either thinking about emotions, problems, or something that happened to you, instead of being absorbed by the activity you were doing.
items.label_parsed: How much time did you spend thinking of one or more emotional experiences? This question refers to how much time you spent lost in your thoughts, either thinking about emotions, problems, or something that happened to you, instead of being absorbed by the activity you were doing.

items.name: negativity
items.label: To what extent were your thoughts negative? This refers to the content of your thoughts: for example if you‚Äôre thinking of a negative situation, negative events, bad memories, unpleasant sensations, discouraging thoughts, thoughts about negative emotions (intense stress, anxiety, anger), ...
items.label_parsed: To what extent were your thoughts negative? This refers to the content of your thoughts: for example if you‚Äôre thinking of a negative situation, negative events, bad memories, unpleasant sensations, discouraging thoughts, thoughts about negative emotions (intense stress, anxiety, anger), ...

items.name: criticism
items.label: To what extent were your thoughts self-critical? This question refers to ‚Äòself-critical‚Äô thinking, meaning thoughts you have about yourself when: you‚Äôre dissatisfied with what you‚Äôre doing or how you‚Äôre reacting, you‚Äôre unhappy with who you are, or when you have goals in mind but you criticize yourself that you haven‚Äôt attained them yet... In contrast, thoughts about yourself that are not ‚Äòself-critical‚Äô: these are encouragements, self-compassion, positive thinking (for ex.: ‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt able to do it now but I‚Äôll get there at some point‚Äù).
items.label_parsed: To what extent were your thoughts self-critical? This question refers to ‚Äòself-critical‚Äô thinking, meaning thoughts you have about yourself when: you‚Äôre dissatisfied with what you‚Äôre doing or how you‚Äôre reacting, you‚Äôre unhappy with who you are, or when you have goals in mind but you criticize yourself that you haven‚Äôt attained them yet... In contrast, thoughts about yourself that are not ‚Äòself-critical‚Äô: these are encouragements, self-compassion, positive thinking (for ex.: ‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt able to do it now but I‚Äôll get there at some point‚Äù).

items.name: brooding
items.label: How much did you think about the causes and consequences of emotional experiences? This refers to if you think of the causes or consequences of one or several emotional experiences (which could be positive or negative) that are either currently ongoing or in the past. A few examples: wondering what caused an argument with your partner; thinking about the consequences of a frustrating phone call; wondering why you have difficulty concentrating; trying to figure out why you feel bad or stressed; thinking about why you messed up a particular task; thinking about the causes and consequences of having failed an exam or a job interview; etc.
items.label_parsed: How much did you think about the causes and consequences of emotional experiences? This refers to if you think of the causes or consequences of one or several emotional experiences (which could be positive or negative) that are either currently ongoing or in the past. A few examples: wondering what caused an argument with your partner; thinking about the consequences of a frustrating phone call; wondering why you have difficulty concentrating; trying to figure out why you feel bad or stressed; thinking about why you messed up a particular task; thinking about the causes and consequences of having failed an exam or a job interview; etc.

items.name: replaying
items.label: To what extend have you mentally replayed emotional experiences that you‚Äôve had? This refers to whether you relived certain scenes from emotional experiences, or ‚Äòreplayed‚Äô an event in your mind (regardless of whether it was a positive or negative experience).
items.label_parsed: To what extend have you mentally replayed emotional experiences that you‚Äôve had? This refers to whether you relived certain scenes from emotional experiences, or ‚Äòreplayed‚Äô an event in your mind (regardless of whether it was a positive or negative experience).

items.name: submit
items.label: Submit `r knitr::asis_output("\U2714")`

units.condition:
# we need to repeat the survey five times a day, so we check whether the nrow() is a multiple of the number of surveys by day
library(lubridate)

# ===================================
# ====== define all variables =======
# ===================================

days_duration_study = 14
surveys_by_day      = 4
timezone            = "CET"
to_day              = today(timezone)
now_date            = now(timezone)
t_zero              = "00:05"
last_timepoint      = "23:30"
timepoints          = c("09:00", "13:00","17:00","21:00")  # write just the hours
ESM_questionnaire   = EF_RUM_ESM_v2_EN

# ===================================
# ===================================

# we check whether the last answer or expired survey was after last timepoint OR if the now() time is after last time point
format(strptime(last(ESM_questionnaire$ended),"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"), "%H:%M") < last(timepoints) || if(exists("ESM_questionnaire$expired")){  format(strptime(last(ESM_questionnaire$expired),"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"), "%H:%M") < last(timepoints) } else { FALSE } || format(strptime(now(),"%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"), "%H:%M") < last(timepoints)

units.description: Repeat till n days of duration study
units.condition:
# repeat till the maximum number of surveys has been achieved
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)

# ===================================
# ====== define all variables =======
# ===================================

days_duration_study = 14
surveys_by_day      = 4
timezone            = "CET"
to_day              = today(timezone)
now_date            = now(timezone)
t_zero              = "00:05"
last_timepoint      = "23:30"
timepoints          = c("09:00", "13:00","17:00","21:00")  # write just the hours

# ===================================
# ===================================


max_surveys = surveys_by_day * days_duration_study

# days = EF_RUM_ESM_v2 %>% mutate(day = as.Date(created)) %>% summarize(n_days = n_distinct(day))

## get date of the beginning of the study
# enrolling questionnaire$created + 1 + n_days

date_start = as.Date(enrolling_surveyEN$created)
last_day_study = as.Date(enrolling_surveyEN$created)+ days(days_duration_study)

today() < last_day_study

items.name: questionnaires
items.label:
## End Questionnaires

Great, you've made it this far. These four questionnaires are the last step before closing this part of the study!
Please take your time to complete these. They allow us to know how you were feeling overall during the study.
items.label_parsed:
End Questionnaires

Great, you've made it this far. These four questionnaires are the last step before closing this part of the study!
Please take your time to complete these. They allow us to know how you were feeling overall during the study.

items.name: QuestionGAD
items.label: **Questionnaire 1 : Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems?**
items.label_parsed: Questionnaire 1 : Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems?

items.name: GAD_1
items.label: Feeling nervous, anxious or on edge
items.label_parsed: Feeling nervous, anxious or on edge

choices.3: More than half of the days

items.name: GAD_2
items.label: Not being able to stop or control worrying
items.label_parsed: Not being able to stop or control worrying

choices.3: More than half of the days

items.name: GAD_3
items.label: Worrying too much about different things
items.label_parsed: Worrying too much about different things

choices.3: More than half of the days

items.name: GAD_4
items.label: Trouble relaxing
items.label_parsed: Trouble relaxing

choices.3: More than half of the days

items.name: GAD_5
items.label: Being so restless that it is hard to sit still
items.label_parsed: Being so restless that it is hard to sit still

choices.3: More than half of the days

items.name: GAD_6
items.label: Becoming easily annoyed or irritable
items.label_parsed: Becoming easily annoyed or irritable

choices.3: More than half of the days

items.name: GAD_7
items.label: Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen
items.label_parsed: Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen

choices.3: More than half of the days

items.name: QuestionBDI_II
items.label: **Questionnaire 2 : This questionnaire consists of 21 groups of statements. Please read each group of statements carefully. And then pick out the one statement in each group that best describes the way you have been feeling during the past two weeks, including today. If several statements in the group seem to apply equally well, circle the highest number for that group.**
items.label_parsed: Questionnaire 2 : This questionnaire consists of 21 groups of statements. Please read each group of statements carefully. And then pick out the one statement in each group that best describes the way you have been feeling during the past two weeks, including today. If several statements in the group seem to apply equally well, circle the highest number for that group.

items.name: BDI2_1
items.label: Sadness
items.label_parsed: Sadness

choices.2: I feel sad much of the time.
choices.3: I am sad all the time
choices.4: I am so sad or unhappy that I can't stand it

items.name: BDI2_2
items.label: Pessimism
items.label_parsed: Pessimism

choices.1: I am not discouraged about my future
choices.2: I feel more discouraged about my future than I used to
choices.3: I do not expect things to work out for me
choices.4: I feel my future is hopeless and will only get worse

items.name: BDI2_3
items.label: Past Failure
items.label_parsed: Past Failure

choices.1: I do not feel like a failure
choices.2: I have failed more than I should have
choices.3: As I look back, I see a lot of failures
choices.4: I feel I am a total failure as a person

items.name: BDI2_4
items.label: Loss of Pleasure
items.label_parsed: Loss of Pleasure

choices.1: I get as much pleasure as I ever did from the things I enjoy
choices.2: I don't enjoy things as much as I used to
choices.3: I get very little pleasure from the things I used to enjoy
choices.4: I can't get any pleasure from the things I used to enjoy

items.name: BDI2_5
items.label: Guilty Feelings
items.label_parsed: Guilty Feelings

choices.2: I feel guilty over many things I have done or should have done
choices.3: I feel quite guilty most of the time
choices.4: I feel guilty all of the time

items.name: BDI2_6
items.label: Punishment Feelings
items.label_parsed: Punishment Feelings

choices.1: I don't feel I am being punished
choices.2: I feel I may be punished
choices.4: I feel I am being punished

items.name: BDI2_7
items.label: Self-Dislike
items.label_parsed: Self-Dislike

choices.1: I feel the same about myself as ever
choices.2: I have lost confidence in myself

items.name: BDI2_8
items.label: Self-Criticalness
items.label_parsed: Self-Criticalness

choices.1: I don't criticize or blame myself more than usual
choices.2: I am more critical of myself than I used to be
choices.3: I criticize myself for all of my faults
choices.4: I blame myself for everything bad that happens

items.name: BDI2_9
items.label: Suicidal Thoughts or Wishes
items.label_parsed: Suicidal Thoughts or Wishes

choices.1: I don't have any thoughts of killing myself
choices.2: I have thoughts of killing myself, but I would not carry them out
choices.3: I would like to kill myself
choices.4: I would kill myself if I had the chance

items.name: BDI2_10
items.label: Crying
items.label_parsed: Crying

choices.1: I don't cry anymore than I used to
choices.2: I cry more than I used to
choices.3: I cry over every little thing
choices.4: I feel like crying, but I can't

items.name: BDI2_11
items.label: Agitation
items.label_parsed: Agitation

choices.1: I am no more restless or wound up than usual
choices.2: I feel more restless or wound up than usual
choices.3: I am so restless or agitated, it's hard to stay still
choices.4: I am so restless or agitated that I have to keep moving or doing something

items.name: BDI2_12
items.label: Loss of Interest
items.label_parsed: Loss of Interest

choices.1: I have not lost interest in other people or activities
choices.2: I am less interested in other people or things than before
choices.3: I have lost most of my interest in other people or things
choices.4: It's hard to get interested in anything

items.name: BDI2_13
items.label: Indecisiveness
items.label_parsed: Indecisiveness

choices.1: I make decisions about as well as ever
choices.2: I find it more difficult to make decisions than usual
choices.3: I have much greater difficulty in making decisions than I used to
choices.4: I have trouble making any decisions

items.name: BDI2_14
items.label: Worthlessness
items.label_parsed: Worthlessness

choices.1: I do not feel I am worthless
choices.2: I don't consider myself as worthwhile and useful as I used to
choices.3: I feel more worthless as compared to others

items.name: BDI2_15
items.label: Loss of Energy
items.label_parsed: Loss of Energy

choices.1: I have as much energy as ever
choices.2: I have less energy than I used to have
choices.3: I don't have enough energy to do very much
choices.4: I don't have enough energy to do anything

items.name: BDI2_16
items.label: Changes in Sleeping Pattern
items.label_parsed: Changes in Sleeping Pattern

choices.1: I have not experienced any change in my sleeping
choices.2: I sleep somewhat more than usual OR I sleep somewhat less than usual
choices.3: I sleep a lot more than usual OR I sleep a lot less than usual
choices.4: I sleep most of the day OR I wake up 1-2 hours early and can't get back to sleep

items.name: BDI2_17
items.label: Irritability
items.label_parsed: Irritability

choices.1: I am not more irritable than usual
choices.2: I am more irritable than usual
choices.3: I am much more irritable than usual
choices.4: I am irritable all the time

items.name: BDI2_18
items.label: Changes in Appetite
items.label_parsed: Changes in Appetite

choices.1: I have not experienced any change in my appetite
choices.2: My appetite is somewhat less than usual OR My appetite is somewhat greater than usual
choices.3: My appetite is much less than before OR My appetite is much greater than usual
choices.4: I have no appetite at all OR I crave food all the time

items.name: BDI2_19
items.label: Concentration Difficulty
items.label_parsed: Concentration Difficulty

choices.1: I can concentrate as well as ever
choices.2: I can't concentrate as well as usua
choices.3: It's hard to keep my mind on anything for very long
choices.4: I find I can't concentrate on anything

items.name: BDI2_20
items.label: Tiredness or Fatigue
items.label_parsed: Tiredness or Fatigue

choices.1: I am no more tired or fatigued than usual
choices.2: I get more tired or fatigued more easily than usual
choices.3: I am too tired or fatigued to do a lot of the things I used to do
choices.4: I am too tired or fatigued to do most of the things I used to do

items.name: BDI2_21
items.label: Loss of Interest in Sex
items.label_parsed: Loss of Interest in Sex

choices.1: I have not noticed any recent change in my interest in sex
choices.2: I am less interested in sex than I used to be
choices.3: I am much less interested in sex now
choices.4: I have lost interest in sex completely

items.name: reread
items.label: **Check that you have answered everything before submitting.**
items.label_parsed: Check that you have answered everything before submitting.

items.name: submit1
items.label: Proceed to the next step
items.label_parsed: Proceed to the next step

items.name: QuestionSTAI_T
items.label: **Questionnaire 3 : A number of statements which people have used to describe themselves are given below. Read each statement and then choose the appropriate answer to indicate how you generally feel. There are no right or wrong answers. Do not spend too much time on any one statement but give the answer which seems to describe how you generally feel.**
items.label_parsed: Questionnaire 3 : A number of statements which people have used to describe themselves are given below. Read each statement and then choose the appropriate answer to indicate how you generally feel. There are no right or wrong answers. Do not spend too much time on any one statement but give the answer which seems to describe how you generally feel.

items.name: STAI_1
items.label: I feel pleasant
items.label_parsed: I feel pleasant

items.name: STAI_2
items.label: I feel nervous and restless
items.label_parsed: I feel nervous and restless

items.name: STAI_3
items.label: I feel satisfied with myself
items.label_parsed: I feel satisfied with myself

items.name: STAI_4
items.label: I wish I could be as happy as others seem to be
items.label_parsed: I wish I could be as happy as others seem to be

items.name: STAI_5
items.label: I feel like a failure
items.label_parsed: I feel like a failure

items.name: STAI_6
items.label: I feel rested
items.label_parsed: I feel rested

items.name: STAI_7
items.label: I am "calm, cool, and collected"
items.label_parsed: I am "calm, cool, and collected"

items.name: STAI_8
items.label: I feel that difficulties are piling up so that I cannot overcome them
items.label_parsed: I feel that difficulties are piling up so that I cannot overcome them

items.name: STAI_9
items.label: I worry too much ovver something that really doesn't matter
items.label_parsed: I worry too much ovver something that really doesn't matter

items.name: STAI_10
items.label: I am happy
items.label_parsed: I am happy

items.name: STAI_11
items.label: I have disturbing thoughts
items.label_parsed: I have disturbing thoughts

items.name: STAI_12
items.label: I lack self-confidence
items.label_parsed: I lack self-confidence

items.name: STAI_13
items.label: I feel secure
items.label_parsed: I feel secure

items.name: STAI_14
items.label: I make decisions easily
items.label_parsed: I make decisions easily

items.name: STAI_15
items.label: I feel inadequate
items.label_parsed: I feel inadequate

items.name: STAI_16
items.label: I am content
items.label_parsed: I am content

items.name: STAI_17
items.label: Some unimportant thought runs through my mind and bothers me
items.label_parsed: Some unimportant thought runs through my mind and bothers me

items.name: STAI_18
items.label: I take disappointments so keenly that I can't put them out of my mind
items.label_parsed: I take disappointments so keenly that I can't put them out of my mind

items.name: STAI_19
items.label: I am a steady person
items.label_parsed: I am a steady person

items.name: STAI_20
items.label: I get in a state of tension or turmoil as I think over my recent concerns and interests
items.label_parsed: I get in a state of tension or turmoil as I think over my recent concerns and interests

items.name: reread2
items.label: **Check that you have answered everything before submitting.**
items.label_parsed: Check that you have answered everything before submitting.

items.name: submit2
items.label: Proceed to the last questionnaire
items.label_parsed: Proceed to the last questionnaire

items.name: QuestionRRS
items.label: **Questionnaire 4 : People think and do many different things when they feel depressed. Please read each of the items below and indicate whether you almost never, sometimes, often, or almost always think or do each one when you feel down, sad, or depressed. Please indicate what you generally do, not what you think you should do.**
items.label_parsed: Questionnaire 4 : People think and do many different things when they feel depressed. Please read each of the items below and indicate whether you almost never, sometimes, often, or almost always think or do each one when you feel down, sad, or depressed. Please indicate what you generally do, not what you think you should do.

items.name: RRS_1
items.label: Think about how alone you feel
items.label_parsed: Think about how alone you feel

items.name: RRS_2
items.label: Think "I won't be able to do my job if I don't snap out of this"
items.label_parsed: Think "I won't be able to do my job if I don't snap out of this"

items.name: RRS_3
items.label: Think about how hard it is to concentrate
items.label_parsed: Think about how hard it is to concentrate

items.name: RRS_4
items.label: Think about your feelings of fatigue and achiness
items.label_parsed: Think about your feelings of fatigue and achiness

items.name: RRS_5
items.label: Think "What am I doing to deserve this?"
items.label_parsed: Think "What am I doing to deserve this?"

items.name: RRS_6
items.label: Think about how passive and unmotivated you feel
items.label_parsed: Think about how passive and unmotivated you feel

items.name: RRS_7
items.label: Analyze recent events to try to understand why you are depressed
items.label_parsed: Analyze recent events to try to understand why you are depressed

items.name: RRS_8
items.label: Think about how you don't seem to feel anything anymore
items.label_parsed: Think about how you don't seem to feel anything anymore

items.name: RRS_9
items.label: Think "Why can't I get going?"
items.label_parsed: Think "Why can't I get going?"

items.name: RRS_10
items.label: Think "Why do I always react this way?"
items.label_parsed: Think "Why do I always react this way?"

items.name: RRS_11
items.label: Go away by yourself and think about why you feel this way
items.label_parsed: Go away by yourself and think about why you feel this way

items.name: RRS_12
items.label: Write down what you are thinking about and analyze it
items.label_parsed: Write down what you are thinking about and analyze it

items.name: RRS_13
items.label: Think about a recent situation, wishing it had gone better
items.label_parsed: Think about a recent situation, wishing it had gone better

items.name: RRS_14
items.label: Think "I won't be able to concentrate if I keep feeling this way"
items.label_parsed: Think "I won't be able to concentrate if I keep feeling this way"

items.name: RRS_15
items.label: Think "Why do I have problems that other people don't have?"
items.label_parsed: Think "Why do I have problems that other people don't have?"

items.name: RRS_16
items.label: Think "Why can't I handle things better?"
items.label_parsed: Think "Why can't I handle things better?"

items.name: RRS_17
items.label: Think about how sad you feel
items.label_parsed: Think about how sad you feel

items.name: RRS_18
items.label: Think about all your shortcomings, failings, faults, mistakes
items.label_parsed: Think about all your shortcomings, failings, faults, mistakes

items.name: RRS_19
items.label: Think about how you don't feel up to doing anything
items.label_parsed: Think about how you don't feel up to doing anything

items.name: RRS_20
items.label: Analyze your personality to try to understand why you are depressed
items.label_parsed: Analyze your personality to try to understand why you are depressed

items.name: RRS_21
items.label: Go someplace alone to think about your feelings
items.label_parsed: Go someplace alone to think about your feelings

items.name: RRS_22
items.label: Think about how angry you are with yourself
items.label_parsed: Think about how angry you are with yourself

items.name: reread3
items.label: **Check that you have answered everything before submitting.**
items.label_parsed: Check that you have answered everything before submitting.

items.name: submit3
items.label: Submit
items.label_parsed: Submit

units.body: ## The study is now complete! ```{r, include=FALSE, warning = FALSE, message=FALSE, echo=FALSE} library(dplyr) library(lubridate) # =================================== # ====== define all variables ======= # =================================== days_duration_study = 14 surveys_by_day = 4 timezone = "CET" to_day = today(timezone) now_date = now(timezone) t_zero = "00:05" last_timepoint = "23:30" timepoints = c("09:00", "13:00","17:00","21:00") # write just the hours ESM_questionnaire = EF_RUM_ESM_v2_EN # =================================== # =================================== days_done = 0 max_surveys = surveys_by_day * days_duration_study # lets check how many questionnaires they filled date_start = as.Date(enrolling_surveyEN$created) last_day_study = as.Date(enrolling_surveyEN$created)+ days(days_duration_study) # get the numbers of day left days_left = last_day_study - today() # difftime(df$datevar1 ,df$datevar2 , units = c("days")) days_done = days_duration_study - days_left # let's create a progress visual progress = "" for(i in 1:days_duration_study) { if(i <= days_done) { progress = paste0(progress, "\n### **Day** **",i,"** ![](https://i.imgur.com/nUY7Ifu.png){width=50px}\n") } else if (i > days_done) { progress = paste0(progress, "\n### **Day** **",i,"** ![](https://i.imgur.com/xuosH6S.png){width=50px}\n") } } ``` Thank you so much for participating in this study and for completing the first part of it. It is because of you and the other participants that this research can take place. Now that you have finished the first part of the study, Yorgo Hoebeke will contact you again to set up the two appointments for the second part of the study via a doodle. *** ### Your progress : `r progress` ***

You did not confirm your email address or mobile phone number in time.

If you still want to participate in the study, please click on this link first: http://formr.org/logout.

settings.footer_text: Contact the [study manager](mailto:<enter your email>) if you have questions.
